column2: Collins has been issued a 10-game suspension for violating the NFL's Performance Enhancing Drugs policy but is expected to be available against the Buccaneers on November 26.
Fuller is on injured reserve with a torn ACL.

Powell has been suspended four games for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs and is recovering from a torn meniscus. He will likely be recovered from the knee injury by the end of September but will only be eligible to play Octobe
Streater sustained a left foot injury and there is no timetable for return.
Matthews has a chip fracture in his sternum but is expected to recover in time for the season opener against the Jets.
Elder has a patella stress fracture and his availability against the 49ers in the season opener is unknown.
Hall sustained a left knee contusion and there is no timetable for return.
Butler suffered a sprained knee during the preseason and his status for the season opener against the 49ers is unknown.
Johnson has landed on the injured reserve list as he underwent surgery to repair a back injury.
Trevathan is recovering from a torn patellar tendon and his availability against the Falcons in Week 1 is in question.
McPhee has been placed on the PUP list with a right knee injury.
Wheaton has a broken finger on his left hand and will miss an unknown amount of time.
Randle has been designated for the injured reserve list with a hamstring injury.
Long is recovering from ankle surgery and it is undetermined if he will be active for Week 1 against the Falcons.
Kush will undergo surgery to fix a torn hamstring and is on the injured reserve list.
Bernard is recovering from a torn ACL that ended his 2016 season and his status for the season opener against the Ravens is up in the air.
Jones has been issued a one-game suspension for violating the league's personal conduct policy. He will be eligible to play against the Texans on September 14.
Wilson has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list after aggravating a previous knee injury.
Williams has a dislocated elbow and is expected to miss four-to-six weeks.
Ross is recuperating from a previous shoulder injury but is likely to make his season debut against the Ravens during Week 1.
Kumerow has been placed on the injured reserve with a leg injury.
Uzomah suffered a lower-leg injury and there is no timetable for recovery.
Iloka sprained his knee but is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Ravens on September 10th.
Greco is recovering from a foot injury and there is no timetable for a return.
Jackson has been placed on injured reserve due to a knee injury.
Bitonio is recuperating from a Lisfranc injury that ended his 2016 season and it is unknown as to if he will be ready for the season opener against the Steelers.
Wilson is on the PUP list due to a fractured kneecap.
Shelton has a knee injury and is expected to miss three-to-six weeks.
Erving has an injury to his calf and it is unclear as to if he will be ready to play in the regular season opener against the Steelers.
Wright has been designated for the injured reserve list with a bruised lung.
Barker has been placed on the injured reserve list with a ruptured left Achilles.
Michael has been designated for the injured reserve list with an injury to an unannounced location.
Geathers is on the PUP list as he is recovering from offseason surgery to repair a neck injury and will miss the first six games of the season.
Morris is on injured reserve with an unspecified injury.
Mount has been placed on the injured reserve with an unspecified injury.
Kelly will have surgery to repair a bone defect in his foot and is expected to miss six-to-eight weeks.
Swoope had a knee scope performed and his status going forward is week-to-week.
Luck has been placed on the PUP list while he recuperates from surgery to repair a torn labrum in his shoulder and his status for the season opener against the Rams is in question.
Ferguson has a hand injury and there is no timetable for return.
Schwenke has been designated for the PUP list with a right ankle injury but is likely to make his season debut against the Rams during Week 1.
Logan has surgery for a dislocated his wrist and is expected to miss 12 weeks of action.
Bucannon has been placed on the PUP list while recovering from surgery to repair a lingering ankle injury but is likely to be available for Week 1 against the Lions.
Zamort has landed on injured reserve due to a torn ACL.
Fua is on injured reserve due to a knee injury.
Irving has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs and will not be eligible to play until Week 5 against the Packers.
Smith is recuperating from a knee injury and a nerve issue that forced him to sit out the entire 2016 season but is expected to make his debut September 10 against the Giants.
Collins sustained a hip flexor injury and there is no timetable for return.
Hamlett has been placed on the injured reserve list due to a fractured fibula and high-ankle sprain.
Elliott has been handed a six-game suspension for violating the league's personal conduct policy. He has appealed the suspension and will be eligible to play until a ruling is made.
Crawford sustained a lateral right ankle sprain and it is unknown as to how much time he will need to recover.
Dysert is on injured reserve due to surgery to repair a herniated disc in his back.
Gregory is serving a year-long suspension for violations of the league's substance abuse policy.
Ray suffered a torn ligament in his left wrist and is expected to miss six-to-eight weeks.
Booker has been designated for the PUP list with a fracture in his wrist but is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Chargers.
Barrett has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a hip injury but is expected to return sometime in September.
Peko has been designated for the PUP list while he recuperates from a surgery to repair a broken right foot.
Kelly is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list while he recovers from a wrist injury.
Butt has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list as he is recovering from offseason surgery to repair a right ACL tear.
Paradis is recovering from two-offseason surgeries to repair his left and right hips but is expected to be available Week 1 against the Chargers.
Winn has been placed on the injured reserve due to a torn ACL.
Wolfe suffered a right ankle sprain but will likely be able to suit up for the season opener against the Chargers.
Thornton has been issued a six-game suspension by the NFL for violating the league's substance-abuse policy but is expected to be available October 29th against the Steelers.
Martin has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an ankle injury.
Decker has landed on the PUP list as he underwent surgery to repair a torn labrum in his shoulder and is expected to miss four-to-six months.
Copeland sustained a torn pectoral muscle and is on the injured reserve list.
Hyder will have surgery to repair a torn Achilles and is on the injured reserve list.
James is on the injured reserve list with a concussion.
Lawrence is on injured reserve with an injury to an unannounced location.
Robinson has landed on the PUP list while he recuperates from offseason foot surgery.
Bryant has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs but is expected to be available against the Bears on October 8.
Ansah has been placed on the PUP list with as he recuperates from a high-ankle sprain that plagued him for most of the 2016 season.
Chubb is on injured reserve due to a knee injury.
Adams has a stress fracture in his foot and it is unclear if he will be ready for the season opener against the Seahawks.
Goodson is on the PUP list while he recuperates from ACL surgery and his status for Week 7 against the Saints is up in the air.
Biegel is on the PUP list while recuperating from surgery to repair a Jones fracture in his foot. He is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Seahawks.
Allison has been suspended one game for violating the league's policy on personal conduct and will be eligible to play against the Falcons on September 17.
Dupre suffered a head injury during the preseason and it is unknown as to how long he will be out.
Waters is on injured reserve with a shoulder injury.
Quessenberry has been battling lymphoma for the past three years and there is no timetable for a return.
Brown has been placed on the reserve/did not report list because he is holding out for a new contract. It is unclear at what point his contract situation will be resolved.
Heath has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with an unknown ailment.
Newton has been placed on the Injured-Reserve/PUP list while recovering from tears to both of his patellar tendons and will not play in the 2017 season.
Fuller broke his collarbone in training camp and is expected to be out until the beginning of November.
Gaines has landed on injured reserve with an injury to his eye.
Robinson has been placed on the injured reserve list with an ailment that has yet to be disclosed.
Johnson has been designated for injured reserve due to a sports hernia.
Lee has a right high-ankle sprain and his status for Week 1 against the Texans is up in the air.
Gaffney has been placed on the injured reserve with an unspecified injury.
Tinker has landed on the injured reserve list due to a torn ACL.
Johnson is recovering from a torn Achilles that ended his 2017 season and his status for opening day against the Patriots is unknown.
Nicolas has landed on the PUP list with a knee injury.
Santos is nursing a groin strain and it is unclear if he will be ready for the season opener against the Patriots.
Goodley is on the injured reserve list with a hamstring injury.
Hali has been placed on the PUP list with a knee injury.
McDonald has been handed an eight-game suspension for violating the league's substance abuse policy but is expected to make his season debut November 5th against the Raiders.
Scott has been designated for the PUP list due to a foot injury.
Misi has landed on injured reserve with a neck injury.
Larsen tore his biceps and it is expected to miss the first eight weeks of the 2017 season.
Urbik will require arthroscopic surgery on his knee and there is no timetable for return.
Ford has been placed on the injured reserve with a knee injury.
Lippett is expected to sit out the entire season due to a torn Achilles.
Tannehill suffered a partially torn ACL in his right knee and is on the injured reserve list.
McMillan tore his ACL and will miss the entire 2017 season.
Barrow has been placed on the injured reserve list with a foot injury.
Bridgewater is on the PUP list while recovering from a dislocated knee and torn ACL.

Floyd has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list as he is recuperating from meniscus surgery that took place last season and team officials are concerned that it could be career-threatening as he is experiencing complications in his recove
Floyd has been suspended four games for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs. He will be eligible to join the team against the Bears in Week 5.
Sankey has been placed on the injured reserve list with a knee injury.
Fairley has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Illness list due to a heart condition.
Swann is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list until he passes his physical.
Ellerbe has been designated for the injured reserve list with a foot injury.
Armstead has been placed on the PUP list as he recovers from surgery to repair a torn labrum and will likely remain sidelined until Week 8 against the Bears.
Breaux fractured the fibula in his left leg and will likely need four-to-six weeks to recover.
Wallace has been designated for injured reserve with an unspecified injury.
Hightower is on the PUP list with an undefined injury.
Rivers is on injured reserve after suffering a torn ACL in his left knee.
Farris has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a torn Achilles.
Thompson has been placed on the injured reserve list after injuring his quadriceps.
Bryant has landed on injured reserve with a dislocated elbow.
Norwood has been designated for injured reserve due to a hip injury.
Williams has been placed on injured reserve while he recovers from offseason knee surgery.
Robinson is dealing with a concussion and his status going forward is week-to-week.
Smith has been placed on the injured reserve list while he recovers from a torn ACL.
Marshall has been handed a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs but is likely to return against the Browns on October 8th.
Clark has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a knee injury.
Stewart is recovering from surgeries on his thumb and groin. His availability for the season opener against the Bills on September 10 is in question.
Seferian-Jenkins has been suspended two games by the NFL for violating the league's substance-abuse policy but is likely to make his season debut September 24 against the Dolphins.
Forte is battling a hamstring injury and his status for Week 1 against the Bills is undetermined.
Middleton sustained a torn pectoral muscle and is on the injured reserve list.
Whitehead will require surgery to repair a broken left foot and will miss an extended amount of time.
Enunwa has been placed on the injured reserve list and will require surgery to repair a bulging disc in his neck.
Keeton has been placed on the injured reserve list with a torn ACL.
Dodd is battling a foot injury that plagued him for most of the 2016 season but is expected to suit up for the season opener against the Raiders.
Brown has been placed on the injured reserve with a hamstring injury.
Davis is batting a hamstring injury and is not expected to play again in the preseason. His status for the season opener against the Raiders is unknown.
Ochi has landed on the injured reserve list with a knee injury.
Williams has been designated for injured reserve with an Achilles injury.
Shittu has been placed on the injured reserve list due to a knee injury.
Jones is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list while he recovers from a torn Achilles' tendon but is expected to be activated sometime in October.
Allen has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list due to a torn pectoral muscle he suffered during the offseason.
Turner has a fractured scapula and is likely to miss three weeks.
Bell had offseason surgery to repair a groin injury but is expected to return to action during Week 1 against the Browns.
Matthews has landed on injured reserve with a torn patellar tendon in his knee.
Heeney has been placed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list due to an ankle injury.
Kirkland has a leg injury and will miss an extended amount of time.
McGill will have surgery to repair a Jones fracture and is expected to miss an extended amount of time.
Conley has been placed on the PUP list while recovering from shin splints.
Smith remains suspended for an undetermined amount of time for violating the league's substance-abuse program.
Penn is currently away from the team as he is unsatisfied with the status of his contract and it is uncertain as to when he will return.
Hill has been issued a two-game suspension for violating the league's substance abuse policy but is expected to return September 21 against the 49ers.
Thomas has been suspended four games for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs. He will be eligible to return against the Seahawks in Week 5.
Austin is dealing with a hamstring injury and it is undetermined if he will play in the season opener against the Colts.
Marquez is on injured reserve with a knee injury.
Laskey has been placed on the injured reserve with an undefined ailment.
Easley has landed on the injured reserve list due to a torn ACL.
Donald is away from the team and is not participating in any football activities and he is unsatisfied with the current status of his contract. It is undetermined as to when he will rejoin the club.
Dunbar has been placed on the PUP list with a knee injury.
Waller has been suspended for at least one year for violating the league's substance-abuse policy.
Dixon had season-ending surgery to repair his medial meniscus and has been issued a four-game suspension for violating the league's policy on performance-enhancing drugs.
Young is on the PUP list with a torn ACL and will miss the entire 2017 season.
Williams is recovering from offseason knee surgery and is not expected to be ready for the season opener against the Bengals.
Lewis needs surgery to repair a shoulder injury and is expected to miss the entire season as a result.
Flacco is expected to be ready for the season opener against the Bengals despite being bothered by stiffness in his back.
Canady suffered a knee injury and will miss an extended amount of time.
Gillmore has been placed on the injured reserve list with after having MCL surgery.
Siragusa suffered a torn ACL in his left knee and is expected to miss the remainder of the season.
Burwell sustained a broken hand and his status for Week 1 against the Broncos is unclear.
Perryman had surgery to fix a torn ligament in his ankle and is expected to miss eight-to-ten weeks.
Attaochu has a pulled hamstring and his status going forward is week-to-week.
Williams is on the PUP list as suffering from a herniated disk in his back but is likely to make his season debut sometime in October.
Cleveland has been placed on injured reserve due to a right knee injury.
Lamp sustained a torn ACL in his right knee and is expected to miss the entire 2017-18 season.
McEvoy had surgery to repair a toe injury and it is unknown as to if he will play against the Packers in the season opener.
Shead underwent surgery to repair the torn ACL in his left knee during the offseason and there is no timetable for a recovery.
Fant suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and is expected to miss the remainder of the season.
Richardson has been diagnosed with an AC joint sprain in his shoulder but is expected to be ready to face the Packers in the season opener.
Jordan had an operation to repair a knee injury and is on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list.
McDowell has landed on the Injured Reserve/Non-Football Injury list with a concussion and facial fractures.
Avril is recuperating from offseason abdominal surgery and a timetable for a recovery has yet to be established.
Garnett had a procedure performed on his knee and is expected to miss the next six weeks as a result.
Ward has landed on the PUP list with a hamstring injury.
Smith sustained a torn pectoral muscle and is on the injured reserve list.
Harold is dealing with a concussion and his status going forward is week-to-week.
Smith is on the PUP list while recovering from ACL surgery and his status for the regular season opener against the Dolphins is unclear.
Martin will miss the first three weeks of the 2017 season as his suspension from the end of the 2016 campaign for violating the league's PED policy will carry over.
Grimes sustained a laceration to his lower leg and needed stitches to close the wound but is expected to suit up for the regular season opener against the Dolphins.
Adjei-Barimah has been diagnosed with a fractured right patellar tendon in his right knee and will likely be out for the season.
Hall is on the PUP list while recuperating from surgery to repair a torn ACL in his knee.
Cravens had offseason surgery to trim the meniscus in his knee but is expected to be ready for the regular season opener against the Eagles.
Bowen is on injured reserve with a left ankle injury.
Murphy suffered an ACL and MLC tear and will spend the entire 2017 season on the injured reserve list.
Marshall has been placed on injured reserve after having surgery to repair a torn right patellar tendon.
